title: Residual Plot
question_text:
A biologist performed linear regression on data and then the plotted the amount of bacteria (response) versus time (explanatory).
If the residual plot shows a clear curved pattern, the original scatterplot of the data most likely has what form?
solution:
Since the residual plot has a curved form, the original data is exponential.

Residuals represent the vertical distance between observed and predicted observations. One should be able to see how these two plots relate to each other. Look at the top plot. The furthest point on the left is clearly above the least squares regression line. This same point is represented on the residual plot as the point on the furthest left but has a positive residual because the point is clearly above the regression line.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'C'.
